items.title: Open Source
items.description: Our code is fully open source, allowing for community contributions, security audits, and complete control over your observability data.

items.title: Open Standards
items.description: We embrace and contribute to industry standards, ensuring compatibility and interoperability with your existing tools and workflows.

cardData.quote: OpenObserve has proven to be a reliable and cost-effective solution built to address real-world challenges.
cardData.name: Wayne Creel

items.title: Lower Storage Costs
items.description: 140x lower storage cost when benchmarked against Elastic Search.

items.title: High Compression
items.description: OpenObserve provides high compression (~40x), columnar storage with Apache Parquet.

items.title: Bring Your Own Bucket
items.description: OpenObserve supports efficient long-term storage including local disk, S3, MinIO, GCS, and Azure Blob Storage.

cardData.quote: [OpenObserve is] super fast, definitely very lightweight, and you can get started with an initial POC in two to three minutes to be honest.
cardData.name: Ajith Natarajan

items.title: Performant Architecture
items.description: OpenObserve utilizes the DataFusion query engine to directly query Parquet files.

items.title: Performant Platform
items.description: Internal query benchmarking of 1 petabyte of data returned in 2 seconds.

cardData.quote: Today, I think we run our entire production logs through OpenObserve... it’s been a phenomenal journey so far.
cardData.name: Shailesh Mangal

items.title: Enterprise Scale
items.description: Providing self-hosted logging for Fortune 100 Enterprises.

items.title: Stateless Architecture
items.description: OpenObserve’s stateless node architecture allows horizontal scaling without data complexity.

items.title: Performant at Scale
items.description: OpenObserve uses result and disk caching to keep the platform performant, even at scale.
